item.title: Forecasting site electricity demand to decarbonize the built environment (with applications in Python)
item.description:
Date/time/location

  • Date: Monday 14 March 2022
  • Time: 15.00-17.00 CET Time, 14.00-16.00 (London)
  • Location: Virtual/Zoom

Register for free

You need to register to receive the Zoom link and attend the workshop by Monday 7 March 2022.

Register here

Instructors

  • Hussain Kazmi, KU Leuven
  • Aditya B. Prakash, KU Leuven

Who is the training for?

  • Anyone who is interested in electricity demand forecasting research and practice, from simple baseline methods to advanced machine learning techniques;

  • A decision maker who wants to learn how these forecasts can be used in decision making and the tradeoffs of modeling approaches;

  • An academic or graduate student that wants to expand their understanding of the state of the art with a hands-on session;

  • Practitioners in the field who are looking for ways to improve their data-driven forecasting.

What participants will learn in the training?

Participants will be able to:

  • Identify modeling approaches and their use in practice;

  • Distinguish a diverse set of challenges in forecasting electricity demand at multiple scales and how these relate to decision making processes;

  • Recognize research directions and better identify numerous sources of open-source electricity datasets;

  • Leverage software for modeling, data acquisition and processing, and evaluation.

Prerequisites

  • Basic knowledge of Python or a high-level programming language.

  • Basic knowledge of statistics and statistical modeling

Outline (2hrs)

TBD
